name: Apple___Apple_scab
cause: Fungus Venturia inaequalis. Favorable conditions are cool, wet weather.
symptoms: Olive-green or brown spots on leaves and fruit; premature leaf drop.
treatment: Use fungicides and resistant apple varieties. Prune and destroy infected leaves.

name: Apple___Black_rot
cause: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa.
symptoms: Dark sunken lesions on fruit, leaves, and bark.
treatment: Prune and remove infected areas. Apply fungicides during the growing season.

name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
cause: Fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. Requires junipers as an alternate host.
symptoms: Bright orange spots on leaves; possible fruit deformities.
treatment: Remove nearby juniper hosts. Use resistant varieties and fungicides.

name: Apple___healthy
symptoms: Healthy green leaves and normal fruit development.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Background_without_leaves
symptoms: Background image detected instead of plant.
treatment: Not applicable.

name: Blueberry___healthy
symptoms: Healthy foliage and berries without visible damage.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Cherry___Powdery_mildew
symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves and fruit; distorted shoots.
treatment: Apply sulfur-based or fungicide treatments. Ensure good air circulation.

name: Cherry___healthy
symptoms: Healthy leaves and fruit; no visible disease symptoms.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_spot
symptoms: Long, narrow gray or tan lesions on leaves.
treatment: Use resistant hybrids and fungicide sprays.

name: Corn___Common_rust
symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces.
treatment: Apply fungicides and plant resistant varieties.

name: Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight
symptoms: Long cigar-shaped grayish lesions on lower leaves.
treatment: Use resistant varieties and fungicides.

name: Corn___healthy
symptoms: Uniform green leaves and healthy growth.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Grape___Black_rot
symptoms: Small black spots on leaves; shriveled fruit (mummies).
treatment: Prune infected areas and apply fungicides.

name: Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles)
symptoms: Tiger-stripe patterns on leaves; sunken lesions on berries.
treatment: Remove infected wood. Avoid injuries to vines.

name: Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
symptoms: Angular dark brown spots with yellow margins on leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides and manage vineyard hygiene.

name: Grape___healthy
symptoms: Healthy green leaves and intact grape clusters.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
cause: Bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter spp. Spread by psyllid insects.
symptoms: Blotchy mottling on leaves, lopsided bitter fruit.
treatment: Control psyllid population and remove infected trees.

name: Peach___Bacterial_spot
symptoms: Dark, sunken spots on leaves and fruit with yellow halos.
treatment: Use resistant varieties and copper-based bactericides.

name: Peach___healthy
symptoms: Vibrant green leaves and undamaged fruit.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot
symptoms: Small water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit turning brown.
treatment: Use copper-based bactericides and resistant varieties.

name: Pepper,_bell___healthy
symptoms: Glossy green leaves and healthy peppers.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Potato___Early_blight
symptoms: Brown concentric rings on lower leaves; leaf yellowing.
treatment: Apply fungicides and practice crop rotation.

name: Potato___Late_blight
symptoms: Large brown patches with fuzzy white growth on underside.
treatment: Use resistant varieties and fungicides.

name: Potato___healthy
symptoms: Green foliage and well-developed tubers.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Raspberry___healthy
symptoms: Healthy canes and fruit without discoloration.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Soybean___healthy
symptoms: Uniform green canopy with no visible lesions.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Squash___Powdery_mildew
symptoms: White powdery coating on leaves and stems.
treatment: Apply sulfur-based fungicides and maintain good air circulation.

name: Strawberry___Leaf_scorch
symptoms: Purplish to brown irregular blotches on leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.

name: Strawberry___healthy
symptoms: Bright green foliage and healthy fruit.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.

name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves and fruits with water-soaked margins.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides and practice crop rotation.

name: Tomato___Early_blight
symptoms: Dark concentric spots on lower leaves; yellowing and leaf drop.
treatment: Apply fungicides and remove infected leaves.

name: Tomato___Late_blight
symptoms: Water-soaked lesions that enlarge rapidly with white growth underneath.
treatment: Use resistant varieties and fungicides.

name: Tomato___Leaf_Mold
symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface with olive-gray mold underneath.
treatment: Apply fungicides and ensure good ventilation.

name: Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot
symptoms: Small, circular dark spots with light centers on leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.

name: Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_mite
symptoms: Tiny yellow spots and webbing on leaves.
treatment: Use miticides or insecticidal soaps.

name: Tomato___Target_Spot
symptoms: Brown circular spots with yellow halo on leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides and ensure good air circulation.

name: Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
symptoms: Upward curling of leaves; yellowing and stunted growth.
treatment: Control whitefly population and use resistant varieties.

name: Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus
cause: Virus transmitted through contact and contaminated tools.
symptoms: Mottled, light and dark green patterns on leaves.
treatment: Remove infected plants and sterilize tools.

name: Tomato___healthy
symptoms: Healthy green foliage and uniformly ripening fruit.
treatment: Maintain good cultural practices for optimal health.
